author: {'@type': 'Person', 'url': 'https://www.moneycontrol.com/author/moneycontrol-news-7285/', 'name': 'Moneycontrol News'}
headline: NCLT admits bankruptcy petition against apparel firm Provogue: Report
description: The firm's total debt to all lenders, including IndusInd Bank, Corporation Bank, Punjab National Bank and SIDBI adds up to Rs 228 crore
articleBody: Moneycontrol News The Mumbai bench of the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) admitted an insolvency resolution against apparel brand Provogue (India) Ltd, according to a report by Mint. Andhra Bank has filed the insolvency petition against the apparel brand, claiming dues of Rs 90 crore. The firm's total debt to all lenders, including IndusInd Bank, Corporation Bank, Punjab National Bank and SIDBI, adds up to Rs 228 crore.  A division bench of Bhaskara Pantula Mohan and V Nallasenapathy named Jitendra Kumar Yadav as a resolution professional after admitting the company for corporate insolvency resolution process (CIRP), the report said.  “There is an admitted debt by Provogue and the company’s account was declared a non-performing asset (NPA) in July 2017,” Rohan Agrawal, counsel for Andhra Bank told the paper, adding that the petition deserves to be admitted.  In FY18, the company posted a loss of Rs 154 crore on sales of Rs 91 crore.  The firm's promoters— Nikhil and Akhil Chaturvedi— lost control of the company in 2016 to a group of lenders led by Andhra Bank, who acquired 51 percent in the company in exchange of debt for equity.  The company is keen on a revival and the lenders are hoping for quick resolution due to good brand recall, Nishit Dhruva, a managing partner of law firm MDP and Partners, who was advising Andhra Bank in the case, told the paper.  The resolution professional, however, feels that it may be too soon to say anything. “It’s too early to say anything but I am looking forward to a faster resolution in the case,” Yadav told the paper. With Provogue joining the insolvency resolution, the number of companies seeking a loan resolution in bankruptcy courts from the textile and garment sector rises to four. Reid &amp;amp; Taylor India Ltd, Mandhana Industries and Alok Industries Ltd are already in various stages of insolvency resolution. Provogue, which started off primarily as a menswear fashion brand in 1998, now sells womenswear and accessories, including watches, footwear and sunglasses.  At its peak in 2011, the company had 350 stores in 73 cities. The firm has its own garment manufacturing facilities in Daman and in Baddi, Himachal Pradesh.
tags: Business, Companies, India, Insolvency resolutions, Provogue

headline: Provogue's board meeting on May 27, 2016
description: Provogue (India) Ltd has informed BSE that a meeting of the Board of Directors of the Company is scheduled to be held on May 27, 2016, inter alia, to consider and take on record the audited financial statements of the Company for the quarter and year ended March 31, 2016.

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Faizan Javed'}
headline: Provogue reports Q3 net loss of Rs 49.73 crore
description: The company had reported a net loss of Rs 21.84 crore during the same period last fiscal, Provogue said in a filing to BSE.
articleBody: Fashion brand Provogue (India) Ltd reported widening of its net loss at Rs 49.73 crore for the quarter ended December 31, 2015. The company had reported a net loss of Rs 21.84 crore during the same period last fiscal, Provogue said in a filing to BSE. Total income from operations of the company also declined to Rs 86.15 crore during the quarter-under review as compared to Rs 142.15 crore in the same period, a year ago.

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Faizan Javed'}
headline: Provogue lenders invoke strategic debt restructuring in firm
description: &quot;Andhra Bank, the leader of consortium of lenders, has informed the company that at the Joint Lenders Forum (JLF) meeting held on January 25, 2016, the lenders have invoked Strategic Debt Restructuring (SDR) in the company and adopted the 'Reference Date' for the purpose as January 25, 2016,&quot; the company said in a BSE filing.
articleBody: Fashion brand Provogue (India) Ltd said its lenders have invoked strategic debt restructuring (SDR) in the company. &quot;Andhra Bank, the leader of consortium of lenders, has informed the company that at the Joint Lenders Forum (JLF) meeting held on January 25, 2016, the lenders have invoked Strategic Debt Restructuring (SDR) in the company and adopted the 'Reference Date' for the purpose as January 25, 2016,&quot; the company said in a BSE filing.

headline: Provogue India: Outcome of board meeting
description: Provogue (India) at its meeting held on February 12, 2015 decided that Mr. Rakesh Rawat, Non-executive Director who has been managing the international business of the Company, shall be retiring from the Board of Director with effect from February 13, 2015.
articleBody: Provogue (India) Ltd has informed BSE that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on February 12, 2015 decided that Mr. Rakesh Rawat, Non-executive Director who has been managing the international business of the Company, shall be retiring from the Board of Director with effect from February 13, 2015 and will exclusively focus on and conduct the international business carried out by the Company through its subsidiary in Hong Kong i.e., Elite Team (HK) Limited.Source : BSE Read all announcements in Provogue

headline: Provogue declares dividend payment date
description: Provogue (India) shall be paying / dispatching dividend for the financial year 2012-13 to the eligible shareholders at the rate of 10 paise per equity share of Re 1 each, between October 05, 2013 to October 12, 2013, subject to the approval of members of the Company in the ensuing AGM scheduled to be held on September 30, 2013.
articleBody: Provogue (India) Ltd has informed BSE that the Company shall be paying / dispatching dividend for the financial year 2012-13 to the eligible shareholders at the rate of Rs. 0.10 paise per equity share of Re. 1/- each, between October 05, 2013 to October 12, 2013, subject to the approval of members of the Company in the ensuing annual general meeting scheduled to be held on September 30, 2013.Source : BSE Read all announcements in Provogue

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'webtech_news18'}
headline: Provogue clarifies on dividend
description: With reference to earlier announcement dated May 30, 2013 regarding Board recommends Dividend, Provogue has informed that there is a typographical error in note no. 4 given on page 4 of the results, wherein the amount of Cash Outflow on account of dividend including taxes has been erroneously mentioned as Rs. 1.33 Lac instead of Rs. 1.33 Crore.
articleBody: With reference to earlier announcement dated May 30, 2013 regarding Board recommends Dividend,  Provogue (India) Ltd  has informed BSE that there is a typographical error in note no. 4 given on page 4 of the results, wherein the amount of Cash Outflow on account of dividend including taxes has been erroneously mentioned as Rs. 1.33 Lac instead of Rs. 1.33 Crore.Accordingly, revised note no. 4 of results should be read as under:&quot;4. The Board has recommended a dividend of Re. 0.10/- per equity share (face value of Re. 1/- each) (i.e. 10 %) subject to the approval of shareholders in the ensuing Annual General Meeting. Cash outflow on account of dividend including taxes would be Rs. 1.33 crores for the financial year ended March 31, 2013.&quot;The Company has submitted to BSE the revised financial results in this regards.Source : BSE Read all announcements in Provogue

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'webtech_news18'}
headline: Provogue (India) recommends dividend
description: Provogue (India) at its meeting held on May 29, 2013, has recommended a dividend of Re 1 (i.e. 10%) per equity share of face value of Re. 1/- each for the financial year 2012-13 subject to the approval of members of the Company at ensuing Annual General Meeting.
articleBody: Provogue (India) Ltd has informed BSE that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on May 29, 2013, inter alia, has recommended a dividend of Re. 1/- (i.e. 10%) per equity share of face value of Re. 1/- each for the financial year 2012-13 subject to the approval of members of the Company at ensuing Annual General Meeting.Source : BSE Read all announcements in Provogue
